intro: Amyema kebarensis, commonly known as the Khabar Valley hakea, is a flowering plant native to the Khabar Valley in Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Amyema kebarensis is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the region's dry climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
